KPK di Bawah Bayang-bayang Suram Dewan Pengawas
04 Nov 2019, 04:45 by M Rosseno Aji, Endri Kurniawati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Pakar hukum pidana Bivitri Susanti suatu hari pernah mengobrol dengan beberapa anggota DPR mengenai revisi Undang-Undang Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (UU KPK). Dia terkejut mendengar penjelasan para anggota dewan tentang maksud penguatan pencegahan korupsi yang menjadi dalih revisi UU KPK.
Menurut anggota DPR itu, kata Bivitri, yang dimaksud pencegahan ialah memberi tahu seseorang yang telah dibidik oleh KPK. Setelah diberi tahu, diharapkan orang itu akan berhenti melakukan korupsi. "Pencegahan itu misalnya ya, saya terendus melakukan langkah-langkah korupsi, maka saya harus dibilangin sudah ketahuan sama KPK, (lalu) stop deh," kata Bivitri menirukan ucapan anggota DPR dalam diskusi di Kantor ICW, Jakarta, Ahad, 3 November 2019.
Penjelasan itu bikin Pendiri Sekolah Tinggi Hukum Jentera ini geleng-geleng kepala. "Itu bukan pencegahan, itu pembocoran supaya orang enggak ketangkap, saya jadi enggak mengerti logikanya seperti apa.”
Menurut Bivitri, revisi UU KPK hanya akan membuat lembaga antirasuah ini menjadi komisi pencegahan korupsi. Sebab, fungsi penindakan KPK dipreteli melalui status komisioner KPK yang bukan lagi penegak hukum, serta keberadaan Dewan Pengawas KPK.
Keberadaan Dewan Pengawas diatur dalam Bab VA UU KPK hasil revisi yang telah dinomori menjadi UU Nomor 19 Tahun 2019. Ketentuan tentang anggota dewan pengawas, terkait tugas, penjabat, hingga tata cara pemilihan tertuang dalam Pasal 37A sampai 37G. Salah satu tugas dewan pengawas yang mendapat sorotan adalah berwenang memberikan izin penyadapan, penggeledahan, hingga penyitaan barang bukti.
Tugas lain dewan pengawas yang tertuang dalam draf perubahan, antara lain mengawasi kerja KPK, menetapkan kode etik, evaluasi tugas pimpinan dan anggota KPK setahun sekali, hingga menyerahkan laporan evaluasi kepada presiden dan DPR. Dewan pengawas terdiri lima anggota, dengan seorang merangkap sebagai ketua. Untuk periode pertama, anggota dewan pengawas diangkat langsung oleh presiden tanpa mekanisme panitia seleksi dan tidak melibatkan DPR.
Presiden Jokowi sudah bersiap-siap menunjuk lima anggota Dewan Pengawas. Ia berjanji akan memilih orang-orang baik. “Percayalah yang terpilih nanti adalah beliau-beliau yang memiliki kredibilitas yang baik,” kata dia di Istana Merdeka, Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019.

KPK in the Dark Shadow of the Board of Trustees
04 Nov 2019, 04:45 by M Rosseno Aji, Endri Kurniawati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Criminal law expert Bivitri Susanti once chatted with several members of the DPR about the revision of the Corruption Eradication Commission Act (KPK Law). He was surprised to hear the explanation from the members of the council about the purpose of strengthening the prevention of corruption which was the pretext of revising the KPK Law.
According to the DPR member, said Bivitri, what was meant by prevention was to notify someone who had been targeted by the KPK. After being told, it is hoped that the person will stop corruption. "Prevention is for example yes, I am caught doing corruption measures, so I must be told that the KPK has been found out, (then) stop it," said Bivitri imitating the remarks of DPR members in discussions at the ICW Office, Jakarta, Sunday, November 3, 2019.
That explanation made the founder of the Jentera Law School shake his head. "That's not prevention, it's leakage so people don't get caught, so I don't understand what the logic is like."
According to Bivitri, the revision of the Corruption Eradication Commission Law will only make this anti-commercial institution a corruption prevention commission. This is because the KPK's enforcement function is stripped down through the status of KPK commissioners who are no longer law enforcers, as well as the existence of the KPK Supervisory Board.
The existence of the Supervisory Board is regulated in Chapter VA of the KPK Law revised results which have been numbered into Law Number 19 Year 2019. Provisions regarding the members of the supervisory board, related to duties, officials, to the procedures for election contained in Articles 37A to 37G. One of the tasks of the supervisory board which is under the spotlight is the authority to give permission for wiretapping, search and seizure of evidence.
Other duties of the supervisory board as outlined in the draft amendment, include overseeing the work of the KPK, establishing a code of ethics, evaluating the duties of KPK leaders and members once a year, to submitting evaluation reports to the president and the DPR. The supervisory board consists of five members, with one concurrently the chairman. For the first period, members of the supervisory board are appointed directly by the president without the selection committee mechanism and does not involve the DPR.
President Jokowi is preparing to appoint five members of the Supervisory Board. He promised to choose good people. "Believe that the chosen ones will be those who have good credibility," he said at the Merdeka Palace, Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
